choreography.text: WELCOME TO A NEW REPUBLIC.
DO YOUR DUTY WELL.

choreography.speaker: Minako
choreography.text: H-hi! Could I ask you for a favor?

choreography.speaker: You
choreography.text: Sure.

choreography.speaker: Minako
choreography.text: Could you look something up for me?

choreography.speaker: You
choreography.text: Sure, that’s what I’m here for.

choreography.speaker: Director
choreography.text: Greetings, servant of the Republic.

choreography.speaker: You
choreography.text: Glory to the Republic.

choreography.speaker: Director
choreography.text: You may recognize me as the director of the Department of Security.

choreography.speaker: Director
choreography.text: I expect my request to be given first priority.
Hey.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: … Yes?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: You work here?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I sure hope so, or I’ll find myself arrested soon.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Ha-ha.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I’m from the Department of Prosperity. I need an agricultural report, or something?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: heww0! c0uld u pw3ase help m3?? :3

choreography.text: Um… why do you talk like that?

choreography.text: … OK.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: We come seeking the truth.
Yes… you’re in the Department of Truth. Can I help you?

choreography.text: Sorry, your what?

choreography.text: 3: my astrowogicalw s1gn!! l1ke t3h constewwations!!

choreography.text: Oh. I don’t really believe in that stuff.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I mean, you can’t even see them anymore anyway because of the screens. So what’s the point?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: ... But sure, what is it?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: 1t’s cancer!!11 :3
choreography.speaker: x_SLAYER_X

choreography.text: … OK.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: These are sensitive times that we live in, Investigator, with the war, you know.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: They are, Director.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Remember in these times that the Minister sees all.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Tell me, when did the war start?
… A long time ago… I think...
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I can find you the date.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: You like your job?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Yes, I do. Maybe not all aspects of it, but yes.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Sucks, I don’t like mine. I’m basically a glorified messenger.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I guess it’s more fun being a glorified record-keeper, Investigator.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: You’d think living under an oppressive regime would at least be interesting.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: H-hi again!
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I’ve seen you around before, haven’t I?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: U-um, I asked you for something else, the other day…
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: No, before that maybe?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Um, I also work here, I suppose…
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I’m cleaning staff. Like, um, cleaning the building.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: … Ah, I guess I didn’t notice.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Oh, that’s okay.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I’m back, I need a study on some new strain of grain.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Sure.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: You ever read what’s in the stuff you hand out?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Don’t read too closely.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I’ll keep that in mind.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: What?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Sorry… It’s a bit hard to understand your accent. Exposure, I guess -- this isn’t the hottest travel destination.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Where did you say you were from, again?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: UwU
choreography.speaker: x_SLAYER_X

choreography.text: Can you get me a copy of the June 15 and July 15 official Economic Reports? From 2142?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Odd, but okay. This is for work?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: O-odd? I don’t think so.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I require last month’s Social Report --
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: The Report? Surely you know --
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Don’t interrupt me. You tread a fine line, Investigator.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: The one we don’t publish. You know where to find it, I presume.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Of course.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: How far do your records stretch?
Do you mean, chronologically? Spatially? Geographically?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Whatever you need to know, I know.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Do you know anything the Minister does not?
Are you a native of the capital, Investigator?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: No. I come from a town in the East.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Was the capital what you imagined when you came here?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: No, it isn’t. But I didn’t come here for the sightseeing. I came here for the work.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: wat r th3  b3st pwaces to v1s1t in t3h repubwic??
choreography.speaker: x_SLAYER_X

choreography.text: Would you like our official Travel Guide?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: n0 wh0 cares waht t3h m1n1ster think5!! w4t do u th1nk??

choreography.text: … You shouldn’t let people hear you say that, you know.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Hi.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Didn’t notice your bracelet before.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Yeah, silver. Nice, isn’t it.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Is that regulation?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: What, are you gonna report me for a bracelet?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I’m not
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Nice to have something of physical value...
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: To whom does the Republic belong?
… The Minister, of course.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I thought this was the Department of Truth.
It is.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: H-haha, I know this is weird, but...
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Could I have the original broadcast on January 28, 2066 of the Minister’s speech?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: G-glory to the Minister! Glory to the Republic!
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: You don’t have to say that, you know.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: W-well, you know with the war and all…
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: You never know…
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Do you love the Republic?
I do.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: So does the Order.
We are more numerous than you think.
Hear the news lately?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: What news?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Fire three buildings down from Department of Liberty.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: How do you know this before I do?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Better that you pretend you never heard this, actually.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Keep your head down.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I-I know your name.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Um, yes. It’s on my desk.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Um, would you like to know mine?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Your name is Minako.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: H-how do you know that? There should be no way! Um, I mean, it’s fine, like the Minister always says, a clean mind --
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: It’s on your name tag.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Oh. What a relief…
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I hope for the fortune of knowing that everyone in the Department of Truth is loyal to the Republic.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Remember to report all suspicion of treason to the Department of Security.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Glory to the Republic.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Glory to the Republic.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Would you mind tipping then?

choreography.text: Great change is upon us.
Will you aid us, or be swept away by the current?
The Order must be informed.
I understand.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Where is the Minister’s arsenal?
You have served your nation well in the years you have been here.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Am I right to believe you trustworthy?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: You are.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: What I ask of you must be conducted with the utmost secrecy.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: This is a great honor.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: And what do you ask of me?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: In times of tension, minds are easily swayed.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: I have reason to suspect…
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: I would like a file on the Directors of Truth and Justice.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: There are several members on the Minister’s Committee of Public Safety, as well…
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Glory to the Republic.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: rawr xd :33

choreography.text: I do feel some patriotism…

choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I know this is not what the Republic is supposed to be.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: You might hear of a lot more stuff like that fire lately.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Why should I?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Harmless accident.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I’m pretty sure fires are harmful.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: … I wouldn’t call it an accident, either.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I know some people who are pretty angry.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Stupid and angry.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: That’s a bit dangerous to say.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Good. It’s good to think that way.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: … But I can’t tell if you really buy into this Ministry stuff.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: H-hi, can I see the state happiness poll --
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: For 10 years ago, during the famine? Or maybe 14 years ago, when the plague --
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I -- yes -- please don’t report me!
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: It’s not illegal to look at reports.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: … Even if you want some things the Republic published that it probably wants you to forget.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: I-I’m not doing this for work. It’s a -- personal project?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I guessed as much.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Eep!
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: … I just told you, it’s not illegal to look.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Thank you.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Freedom awaits the new Republic.
The wall that surrounds the capital…
Where is it be penetrable?
The doors, maybe? I came through the checkpoint when I applied to move here.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: That’s not what I mean.
It’s best if the guards don’t know.
Have you heard of the Order of [REDACTED], Investigator?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Anything that you find on the Order and the Minister’s government -- deliver it to me.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Do not mention this name to anyone else.

choreography.text: It is a seditious evil.

choreography.text: Yo.

choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: … Isn’t that pretty old slang?
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Most people have forgotten stuff like that. That’s what makes it cool.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: Better to be forgotten than banned, I suppose.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Yeah, isn’t that lit? Isn’t it gucci?
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: … I can tell I’m losing you.
choreography.speaker: Julia

choreography.text: I can trust you, right?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Y-you’ve read all these reports?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: Maybe “skimmed.”
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Well, then you know that we’ve been lied to.
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: D-discrepancies between Economic Reports in the same year, between the history of the war and the Minister’s speech… There was a plague and e-everyone was cheerful! Is the war e-even --
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: I know that.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: There’s a lot more than you think like that.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: So you know? And do nothing?
choreography.speaker: Minako

choreography.text: What do you think of the war?
It’s harder to buy oranges. The chocolate gets bitterer every year.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: It was easier to notice when I lived outside the capital. Sometimes it doesn’t seem real, except for those little things.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Sometimes blood needs to be shed.
Sometimes a war needs to begin.
Tell me of the water supply to the capital.
You used to live in the East?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: That’s right.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Did you live close to the Tyrian border?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Not really.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: That’s lucky. We find those near the border to be most susceptible to unclean thought.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Doubly dangerous in the war, you know.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Do you believe our borders to be impenetrable?
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Well, I’m not the Director of Security.
choreography.speaker: You

choreography.text: Foreign agents…
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Conduct an investigation for me.
choreography.speaker: Director

This is your chance to free us all from evil.
Get us control of the Minister’s Peacekeeping drones.
The Order thanks you.
Haste.
You would be willing to do anything for your country, would you not?

choreography.text: These are orders from the Minister himself.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Hide this device inside the office of the Director of Truth.

choreography.text: This is the sequence to broadcast.

Welcome to a new order.
We thank you for your role.
You have been spared from the purges.
We welcome you to our ranks.
Thank you.

Well done, Investigator.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: You have proven yourself a valuable servant to the state, and you have preserved the security of the Republic.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: We have uncovered the plot of the Order and the Director of Truth has been rehabilitated.
choreography.speaker: Director

choreography.text: Your salary has been upgraded to level 4 as a reward for your service.
